title: American Airlines was great trying to help us!
text: My family and I were traveling to Milan, Italy via London through Chicago. The morning of our flights, British Airways cancelled the flight and did not rebooked us. AA tried very hard to get us to Milan in different ways. They tried in the phone and they advised us to go to the airport. They tried in Tucson, but they told us to check in Chicago. Once in Chicago they got us booked in a different flight to Milan from London. They could not put us together, but we made it. Thank you American for helping us out when British Airways abandoned us!

title: They cancelled my flight on the day of departure!
text: On the day of my departure, they cancelled my flight from London to Milan and they did not rebook us. I had to call BA on the phone, waited almost 1 1/2hr for a person from India that did not speak English well, to try to help me. It seems their computer system was not working on that day, because they told me to go to the airport. At the airport neither American Airlines which was connecting to British Airways was able to rebook us. Only once i got to Chicago, they were able to rebook us, but by then the 3 of us traveling together, had to sit in separate seats, not even together. We all had paid for special seats with leg room and to be together and nothing. They did not even return the money we paid for the seats. Horrible experience on a very busy day, it should have never happened!

title: Great cod and chips at the airport
text: After a long trip from the USA we were hungry so before our next connection to Italy, we had food here. You chose a table with a number first and then you went to order. Based on the number of your table they would bring you your food. It was really good.

title: Great place for drinks with fantastic atmosphere!
text: We stopped by to have drinks here and they had a watermelon pisco sour that was to die for. Really wonderful atmosphere surrounded by great service and wonderful munchies. Great for groups and couples.

title: Delicious Peruvian Food in the middle of Geneva!
text: We had several dishes and appetizers. Incredibly well served, very fresh ingredients and only the best. It is so hard to find authentic ingredients that I was amazed at how authentic the flavors were and how beautifully presented it was. Would go back right away. Thank you Chef Cecilia for an unforgettable lunch!

title: Delicious food!
text: Great food in Fira, we had several local dishes from santorini. Almost all had fresh fish and seafood. They were all fresh and delicious. The place is cute and the service was fast and nice. We would go back there in seconds!

title: It is huge!
text: In the middle of the entrance to the Ferrari Factory in a sort of huge park. The prancing horse is there in the middle of it surrounded by a lot of vegetation. You cannot miss it going around the park towards the entrance of the factory

title: You have to do this a Ferrari experience!
text: I went with my best friend to do this VIP experience that took almost all day. They picked us up from Modena and it included simulator, video recording of my driving, lunch and a tour of a vineyard. I skipped the vineyard since I have done that in another trip to other parts of Italy. You need to experience this driving, you will not regret. This was a highlight of my life!

title: Amazing place to visit!
text: After I drove the Ferrari 458 for half an hour they took us to visit the museum . This place was full of all different types of Ferrari cars including Formula One cars and motors. Amazing to be able to see them all in one place

title: Exciting, fast driving a Ferrari 458
text: The tour picked us up from our hotel in Modena for an all inclusive visit, with lunch, visit to the museum, formula one simulator and driving. We chose 30 minutes driving and we were able to drive all over the city and highway. He kept saying “go faster”. It was such an exciting experince

title: Great place for Drinks and relaxation!
text: It is mostly a drink place, we were told to have drinks here mainly Campari and we did. Across the galleria was the building were their competitors have their site. We sat there to talk and enjoy the wonderful atmosphere of the place and the galleria Vittorio Emanuele

title: We had an amazing dinner here!
text: We ordered a plate prosciutto that came with artisan bread, we also ordered the costoletto alla Milanese. If you order this make sure that you share it. It is huge! We were not able to order dessert because the meal was huge and we had ordered two of them. Great place, modern, great service!

title: Magical, incredibly beautiful theater
text: We went to see modern ballet on November 27th and we found ourselves watching the incredible Roberto Bolle dancing Ravel’s Bolero. The acoustics were incredible. I could hear each instrument behind me perfectly clear. The setting was beautiful and magical

title: The last Supper is here,
text: We took a great tour to see I’ll Cenacolo and the last supper. It was an amazing day to see and walk through the. Hutch and to finally be able to see in person “The Last Supper”. The whole wall was adorned with the painting and you can see the history in pictures and videos of the painting

title: Lovely visit via elevator!
text: Even on a rainy cold day, we wanted to go to the top of the Duomo. The wait for the elevator was short and we went up quickly. It is amazing to be able to walk all the paths on top and to be able to see the details of such an incredible place

title: Beautiful Leonardo exhibit
text: This is a huge place with numerous exhibits going on in different sections of the castle. We went to see the Leonardo exhibit and of course it was magnificent. It was 5 blocks from I’ll Cenacolo and you could easily do both on the same day

title: Beautiful place, it is huge!
text: This piazza is huge and has a metro station at the side of it duomo. It has many stores and restaurants all over the place. The birds are all in the plaza and you can actually feed them and they will come over you.

title: Great place to walk, shop and eat!
text: This is a massive structure that is amazingly gorgeous. It is full of restaurants and stores. They had a huge Swarovski Christmas tree in the middle and it was a beautiful place to walk. It was close to La Scala and also I’ll duomo

title: Loved seeing the Last Supper here!
text: We were able to get our tickets ahead of time for our tour and it was great. I thought that it was a small painting but it took a whole wall of the interior of it Cenacolo. Amazing the videos, pictures and history of how they protected the painting during the war

title: Breath taking church
text: We were lucky to be there a day that a musical group was recording and the music was amazing. It was a cold day but regardless we took the elevator to the top and saw the city and the top of this magnificent place

title: Amazing Milanese food in the middle of the Vittorio Emanuele Galleria!
text: Had a fabulous Milanese dinner of costoletto a la Milanese with artichoke purée and risotto. We ordered the inferno wine, typical of Lombardy. We were serenaded by Rafaella and I got to sing with her. It was an amazing dinner and not to expensive!

title: Gelato, sandwiches and more!
text: My friend ordered gelato with two flavors while I ordered a sandwich, and a torta fetta con panna. The girl server was very polite and fast. She was in charge of this small gelateria but was able to do a great job. She heated the sandwich so I could take it to the apartment. Gelato and all the food was delicious!

title: Fabulous sandwiches and pastries
text: We ordered two sandwiches of cheese and coldcuts, French fries, tartuffo, tiramisu, cheese cake. The pastries were all fresh and flaky. The bread was amazing. We had great and fast service and the food was delicious

title: Small, busy but delicious food,
text: This little coffee is in the outside of the Vittorio Emanuele Galleria. It is a very busy place and they need more servers for the amount of business they have. We had to wait a bit, but afterwards we were served by a very nice and handsome server who had a lovely attitude. Even though it took time to be served, we ate well, their different kinds of chocolate pastries and their cappucino warmed us up and filled us well

title: Pastries are to die for!
text: We went to see the cantaloupe Sforzesco and after the exhibits, we went inside this lovely cafe inside the entrance to the castle. The gentleman manning the coffee and serving was great. He suggested to us the chocolate kiss which was an amazing taste of nuts, chocolate and flour. We ordered many different types of Milanese pastries and they were all fresh and delicious. Service was impeccable and quick.

title: Best pastries and cappuccino,
text: I stayed next door in a rented apartment so that I may attend a conference at the Politecnico de Milano, Bovisa Campus. I would have fresh cappuccino with pastries there every morning. They also offered few typical Milanese dishes for lunch. Really cute place and full of Italian customers. When I see people from the region patronizing a particular place, I follow suit, and it was amazing. Thank you for making my work days amazing,

title: Close to train station and great hotel
text: It is two blocks from the train station, surrounded be restaurants and perfect location for us. The room was comfortable, the bed was good to sleep on. No noises at night time even though it is close to a Main Street. The breakfast offered many choices from fresh fruits, pastries to cheeses, cold cuts. Coffee was amazing. Would stay again here anytime

title: What happened to seats in Air France, most uncomfortable flight!
text: I will never get to do this again, this flight was a direct flight from Amsterdam to Los Angeles, and it was so uncomfortable. They skipped one meal on us, we were all very hungry and it was just wait too long. I am going back to Europe from Los Angeles again, but I am breaking the trip in pieces, Los Angeles to Chicago or New York. It was insanely long, the seats were not comfortable, the food was not that great, and they skipped a meal on us. I used to take Air Frnace when it used to have so much better service, it was a delight to fly in AF. Not much anymore.

title: Excellent place, great breakfast!
text: I went with four friends and we had one of the best breakfast ever. They make their own chorizo which is meaty and not too fatty. I had an omelet with chorizo which was huge. They can bring you fresh sauce, fresh made tortillas if you want to to. The coffee was amazing. My friend had menudo and she loved it.

title: Nice to walk around on a sunny day
text: The boardwalk is full of restaurants, shops that sell souvenirs and it shows you how beautiful that area is. You can buy one of a kind things around here, you will not find anywhere else. The restaurants are fantastic and a more historic site you could not find.

title: They are brokers and they hire others to do the tour
text: The tour itself was handled by fun times and not tourist Israel. They took us to Betlehem and the Dead Sea. The tours were well made, in comfortable buses. The guide was very knowledgeable and nice. The only bad thing was that the tour website for Tourist Israel makes you believe that you are only stopping by the Dead Sea to see it, when in reality the stop is about 2 hrs long and you can bathe in the Dead Sea. My brother and my husband were able to rent bathing suits, but I was not. So I missed the experience of being in the lowest point of Earth and to be unsinkable.

title: Really great way to see the Nile!
text: Our tour guide picked me up on time and took me to take the boat for a dinner in the Nile. It had a show of dances and a male dancing with a sword too. The belly dancer was also quite good. The dinner was fine too.

title: Amazing show!
text: I did not take the transport, but I did go and see the show, since my hotel was one block from the Great Sphinx. It was a marvelous laser show that you cannot miss.

title: I bought many Papyrus paintings!
text: This museum was close to my hotel, so i was able to stop there and purchase personalized papyrus. I bought one for a friend of mine that could not come with us to this tour. I was able to personalized it in a cartouche kind of way with her name painted in the papyrus.

title: Tutankhamon is here!
text: I was able to go one day very early to the Museum. I had learned from various internet sources that it did not have air conditioning. Even though I went in March, i wanted to make sure that it was not in the afternoon so that i would have a pleasant visit. I arrived early in the morning and was able to have a wonderful visit. You have to pay more to take pictures and to visit the Tutankhamen exhibit

title: They have a show at night time!
text: Day or night the Great Sphinx is a marvel to see. At night time they have a laser show that depicts the story of Egypt and how the Sphinx would have looked. An amazing experience!

title: you have to go inside!
text: Because I stayed in a hotel so closed to the Pyramids, I was able to walk there and stare at the beauty and magnificence of the Pyramids. One day i went inside the Pyramids and although it was a bit hot inside, and a bit claustrophobic, that experience was priceless.

title: Marvelous hotel, close to the Pyramids and wonderful people
text: What a great older house, run by an Egyptian family. Every single person was amazing. They picked me up from the airport and I had a great room with view of the Pyramids. We were a bit far from the city, but my intent was to see the Pyramids every day and i got what i wanted. The terrace is a great place to see them too, and the street was full of shops, papyrus paintings, perfumes, and little restaurants. I felt secured, welcomed and the food for breakfast was amazing. I am going back next March.

title: Tourist Israel is a BROKER, then they give you to Fun-Times company and you pay a fortune!
text: So far i feel that i have been duped. There were a lot of things, our tour cost $948 for 3 of us, then each one also had to pay $150 at the border with Jordan. That makes it 466 US dls. per person. We had to get up really early to meet the group in front of a hotel. That is when we noticed that it was not Tourist Israel picking us up, but rather a different group called Fun Times. The drivers were very nice. We were first picked up in a small van and 1 hr later, we were transferred to a large more comfortable bus with WIFI. Our driver was very nice and our tour guide was Jordanian so he knew a lot of history about his country. That was ok until the pit stop we did in a "store" to have tea and use the bathrooms. We were given water and tea but "conveniently" this place was a huge store with everything overpriced. Our guide said to buy anything to do it here because in Petra we would not have the time. I did, but In Petra they were way cheaper. REMIND yourself, especially if you are coming from the USA that although they are saying to you $100 dinar, it is really 200 dollars. It cost double for Americans because of the exchange rate. So better, buy them at Petra themselves, the people were nicer, they were not pushing you to buy at their store. You could not walk without being followed by them.. One replica knife and a coat ended up costing $400 US dollars. I was very disappointed that our guide would do that. It was obvious he had an agreement with that store.

title: You can avoid this massive structure!
text: This is part of the Old City and is one of the main entrances to the Old City in Jerusalem. Amazing to see all the city from the top and you can start your tour there too. At then entrance has stores, small restaurants and shops.
place: Golden Gate (Bab el Rahmeh, Sha'ar Harahamim)

title: I did this tour with Funtimes.com and they were great!
text: The only drawback i had, is that nowhere in the brochure do they tell you to bring your bathing suit. So my husband and my friend were able to rent one, but i was not. I wish they could have said something. the brochure makes you think that you will just stop to see it, in reality they stop for close to 2 hours to go and bathe in the sea. So bring it along. Otherwise, the tour was great.

title: Jerusalem, Bethlehem and the Dead Sea! Take your bathing suit!
text: They picked us up from King David street, in front of a hotel and they were on time. The drivers were nice and knowledgeable. They took us to the Palestinian side to see the Church of the Nativity, we saw the caves, we stopped at a store to buy souvenirs --probably arranged ahead of time among themselves-- and then we went to the Dead Sea. The only regret I have, is that nowhere in the literature do they say bring your bathing suit. It makes it feel that you are just stopping to see it and we are going. But in fact the stop there is close to 1 hr so you can actually go down the steps and bathe in the Dead Sea. I did not bring my bathing suit, and my husband rented one so that he could. Otherwise, it was nice. Oour guide for Jerusalem was very nice, and he knew a lot of history and we spent a very nice day with him. The Church in Betlehem was also very nice, loved the pillars and the entrance.

title: You have to pass by it on your way to the Western Wall
text: We took a tour that took us around the whole place. It is amazing that with a turn you are in the Jewish Quarters, or in the Muslim, the Christian or the Armenina. Very distinct clothing and shops give you the clues, unless your guide lets you know. But it is very clear when you see the clothing of the people change and their products for sale too. It was a colorful visit to the Old City and walk through all the Quarters. You can see the Menorah in a glass container, you can see the one muslim Temple in the middle of the Jewish Quarter, and also some of the historical sites that are preserved for people to see. Really nice walk. Enjoy it!

title: Great place to see part of the city and the Cemetery!
text: We went there briefly after our visit to the Old City. It is basically to the side of the whole area of the Old City, and when you go up there you will see hills, and the Cemetery where nowadays most jewish people are buried there. There are some Churches on the way, and also some tombs of important saints. Be careful of the people selling you the maps, they are also pickpockets.

title: It stands in the middle of a huge plaza!
text: An important visit especially for muslims, but historically is a very important site. You can see one of the foundation stones to one of the ancient Temples. There was so much religion history withint the whole site, the Western Wall and the Old City, that is overwhelming.

title: We got up at 4:30 so that we could start it by 5:00am
text: We started at Lion's Gate. We took a taxi there and the three of us started our way there. We were able to get to all the stations, but had a hard time finding station 9 until we finally got it, and then we continue to the Church of the Holy Sepulcher where we finished the last 4 stations. I was surprised that it did not take us that long, probably 30 minutes at the most, and we got lost a couple of times, but people were so nice to help us find our way when we could not. At each station we said a prayer and continue on. The three of us hugged and cried for having done this together all the way from Tucson,AZ and Rochester, NY.
place: The Way of the Cross - Via Dolorosa

title: Great to visit, we went early in the morning at 5am!
text: It was great to have the whole Church to ourselves. We got up early to do all the stations and we basically had the Old City streets and the Church for ourselves, so we were able to have a lovely visit. The Tomb is in the first floor almost as soon as you get there. It was lovely to not fight with others or have to be in line to be able to touch it and pray.

title: A must do, the last 4 stations are here!
text: I was touched, it was an incredible experience to be able to touch the sacred stones that cover Jesus Tomb. I was able to feel close to God and pray for my family and friends. It is better to visit it early in the morning. They open at 5am, and you will have the chance to have the Church to yourself. Otherwise, it will be packed with tourists and you will not be able to get to touch nor visit the stones that cover Jesus tomb since the lines are so long. Instead, go there early. I was there at 5am and we had the church for ourselves. It was a relieve to have the place to ourselves, it was calmed, we felt close to God here, without anyone but a mass that was taking place early in the morning. It was a great visit.

title: Magnificent, It was a highlight for us!
text:
The three of us went with a tour group and they took us to the Western Wall as part of our tour of Old Jerusalem. It was a really beautiful sunny day. My husband and my brother both wore their Karmulkah and I got my veil. They explained to us that once you pray and you touch the wall and perhaps leave your messages to God, when is time to leave, you do not give your back to the Wall, you slowly back-out.
What bothered me perhaps is that the men side was much larger than the females, and then there were 2 rows of females sitting down in their chairs and they were not letting anyone pass by them. I did not come all the way from Tucson, Arizona, to not touch the wall or leave my message to God. So as soon as one of the ladies stood up, i took her chair out, and moved the one in front, and i was able to actually get close to the wall and pray. Other females behind me follow me and did the same thing. I was touched and felt elated to be able to have this personal experience, alas alone, since my husband was on the other side, but I did. I was able to pray for all my family and friends and have a moment with God.

title: Amazing visit to Old City!
text: We were able to visit not only with a tour, but also by ourselves. We wanted to do all the stations of the Via Dolorosa, but we were unable to do it during the day, too many tourists. So we woke up one day at 4am and we got to Lion's Gate at 5:00am to start our own tour, the three of us of the Via Dolorosa. We felt so close to God and it was just marvelous to have all these old streets for ourselves. Surprised the the Church of the Holy Sepulchre would open so early too, so we were able to see everything and touch all the holy places that early in the morning.

title: Amazing apartment although in noisy street!
text: Getting to the apartment was not bad at all, finding the door on the side of the building and then getting the code was not difficult. Afterwards we found our keys to our apartment and we found it nice and clean, perfect for three adults. We had washer, dryer and anything we might need to cook and clean ourselves. Behind the apartment there is a small supermarket so we were able to walk 20 steps and get food to cook in our kitchen. We had coffee, tea that they left for us on the table. The young lady was amazing and so friendly. Thank you for making our stay in Jerusalem, a lovely stay.

title: Really nice little drive there, but you can walk there too!
text: Because we rented a small fiat, we were able to go through all Santorini in the car and see everything we wanted to see. This lighthouse was one of our stops. Really nice place to see the sunset too.

title: Wonderful red boulders and sand
text: Really nice beach to walk by and see the huge boulders that are a beautiful red color, really amazing. The sand was wonderful too. Just a lovely day to look at it.

title: Wonderfully preserved
text: Loved being able to walk through the ruins and see this little town and how they have been preserving it. Loved the walkways all through it so you can have a close view of everything. Loved the houses, steps, windows in some of the houses that were so well preserved. The amphoras were just beautiful

title: Dimitra was superb and the apartments were fantastic!
text: Thank you Dimitra for making our stay at your hotel absolutely fantastic. We were a bit cold, but not big deal once you gave us the thick blankets, we were perfectly comfortable. We loved that you were able to get us a rental car too, we appreciate all your kindness and great service. Thank you for everything. We hope to come back one day again.

title: We went on our own and this was fantastic to see. Very well preserved!
text: Loved seeing the ruins that are so well preserved for all of us to see. I was impressed with the streets, the houses and the one thing i will always remember is the room with the big colorful amphoras. We were wondering if it was a room to save food or something like that. Loved that there were so many hallways to walk through the ruins. Wonderful
place: Archaeological bus tour to Akrotiri excavations & Red beach

title: very nice, clean and very polite crew
text: Fabulous, on time, polite crew, great snacks. The only draw back was not in Athens to Tel Aviv flight, but actually in Athens to Santorini. It was way too windy to be walking outside and going up the staircase. Because it was such a cold day, I ended up sick with a terrible cold. Otherwise, everything was great.

title: They did not let me board my plane to Paris
text: Delta-KLM-AF are all now one company. When I flew from Tucson to Los Angeles, Delta never said one thing to me about my passport having 5 months and 25 days left. While boarding in LAX my name was called and it was then that the AF agent told me i could not board the plane. He was counting with his fingers the days and told me that I needed 6 months in my passport, that Egypt nor Turkey would give me visas. When i provided my visas for them to see, they still did not let me board saying that France would not let me enter either. Because according them I was a NO SHOW, AF invalidated my original ticket and made me purchase a new set of tickets for 4 days later when i could get an emergency passport. This was the worst treatment. The least they could have done was to use my original tickets and let me re-use them 4 days later. Nope, i had to buy new tickets for 2 people. My husband could not fly because he has confusion caused by medications for Parkinsons, so we had to arrive to our 2nd country Israel, rather than Egypt. We lost all that portion of our trip.

title: Great Pasta wtih good service!
text: Our hotel was in front of this restaurant, so we stopped by and we got 2 different plates of pasta and we also took a hamburguer for my husband to the hotel. Everything was delicious and it was not that expensive. It is small, very cute, and it has a small bar on the side. It is longer than a square. Really nice place to eat.

title: Beautiful during the day or at night
text: You can enjoy seeing all the large transantlantic ships and cargo ships anchored in the marina, beautiful colors and nice thing to do before you go for dinner.
